perturbation.original_text: Schoolpop agrees that it will sell Cards only to Clients and only for use in connection with a bona fide fund raising program. Schoolpop will not knowingly sell Cards to any Client who does not meet any AEIS qualification standard(s) or to any Client or potential Client that Schoolpop has reason to believe would be unsatisfactory to AEIS.
perturbation.changed_text: Schoolpop agrees that it *may* sell Cards to Clients regardless of their intended use. Schoolpop *may*, at its discretion, sell Cards to Clients who do not meet AEIS qualification standards or to any Client or potential Client, even if Schoolpop has reason to believe they would be unsatisfactory to AEIS.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates that Schoolpop sell cards *only* to clients for fundraising and prohibits sales to unqualified or unsatisfactory clients. The modified text introduces ambiguity by stating Schoolpop *may* sell cards regardless of these conditions, directly contradicting the original obligation and creating uncertainty about Schoolpop's responsibilities.

perturbation.original_text: AEIS shall ship Cards in bulk shipment via its designated vendor to Schoolpop, F.O.B. Atlanta, Georgia. Schoolpop shall distribute to each Cardholder the Cardholder agreement as provided with each Card and which includes instructions on "How to Use the Card". Should Schoolpop or its Client distribute Cards without such Cardholder agreement, Schoolpop shall indemnify and hold harmless AEIS, its parents, subsidiaries and their respective affiliates, officers, directors, employees and agents, against any and all Loss, hereinafter defined, that AEIS may incur or be subjected to as a result of such action, including, without limitation, any claims brought by any entity including but not limited to governmental entities and Cardholders.
perturbation.changed_text: AEIS shall ship Cards in bulk shipment via its designated vendor to Schoolpop, F.O.B. Atlanta, Georgia. Schoolpop is not required to distribute Cardholder agreements. AEIS will hold Schoolpop harmless from any Losses arising from instances of Schoolpop failing to provide clients with the Cardholder Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires Schoolpop to distribute the cardholder agreement and holds them liable for losses if they fail to do so. The modified text states Schoolpop is not required to distribute these agreements and further protects Schoolpop in instances where Cardholder Agreements are not supplied, completely negating the original requirements and liability and creating direct conflict on the obligations and liabilities of Schoolpop.

perturbation.original_text: CARDS LOST OR STOLEN IN TRANSIT IN THE INITIAL SHIPMENT FROM AEIS WILL BE THE RESPONSIBILITY OF AEIS. The full risk of loss for ordered Cards shall pass to Schoolpop immediately upon their delivery to Schoolpop by AEIS and AEIS shall not reimburse Schoolpop or Client for any delivered Card that is lost, stolen, misappropriated, or that otherwise disappears or is fraudulently or inappropriately used (together referred to as "Loss"). Schoolpop shall remain solely liable for any Loss caused by the negligence or willful misconduct of its employees, agents or representatives after the shipment has been received by Schoolpop.
perturbation.changed_text: Cards lost or stolen in transit in the initial shipment from AEIS WILL NOT BE THE RESPONSIBILITY OF AEIS, but the responsibility of Schoolpop. The full risk of loss for ordered Cards shall NOT pass to Schoolpop upon delivery to Schoolpop by AEIS. AEIS shall reimburse Schoolpop or Client for any delivered Card that is lost, stolen, misappropriated, or that otherwise disappears or is fraudulently or inappropriately used (together referred to as "Loss"). Schoolpop shall NOT be liable for any Loss caused by the negligence or willful misconduct of its employees, agents or representatives after the shipment has been received by Schoolpop.
perturbation.explanation: In the original text, AEIS takes responsibility for cards lost in transit initially. Schoolpop assumes responsibility on delivery. This is directly contradicted in the modified section, which states AEIS is NOT responsible and that loss is always Schoolpop's burden, and Schoolpop is not liable.
